channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping Swindon Road, 18th January
item.description:
3 black bin bags on Swindon Road between St Pauls Lane and St Pauls Street North

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Normal Terrace, Cheltenham

item.title: Flytipped Barbeque, 18th January
item.description:
The location is approx 20 yards from the Burnt Oak Crossroads on the left going towards Whittington. A drum Barbeque has been tipped here. Please can it be cleared up as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Xmas tree and card, 18th January
item.description:
Left by tree.

item.title: Dead Animal/Debris, 18th January
item.description:
There is a dead animal/debris on the M5 Northbound between lane 2 & 3 just before the motorway bridge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Previously broken white line in the middle of the Albion Street was covered with extended solid line, 18th January
item.description:
It looks like a broken white line in the middle of the road, was repainted with extended solid white lane. The solid lane in the middle of Albion Street was extended along junction with CitiPark access and crossroad with Gloucester Place road. Current state is present on attached pictures Pic1 and Pic2, while previous state is present on Pic3. Suspected that while repainting of the road markings the previously broken white line was repainted with solid line, what causes confusion on junction with CitiPark, and crossroad with Gloucester Place road, because of the solid white line extended along. Crossing of the solid white line may cause penalty charge. In this repored case acces to CitiPark and Gloucester Place road causes crossing the solid lane in the middle of the Albion Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 70a Albion Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road drain cover 40 Bouncers Lane movement, 17th January
item.description:
This road drain cover is loose AGAIN. This means every vehicle which goes over it makes a loud noise. Which means opening windows at night impossible to sleep. Also during the day every vehicle makes a very unpleasant noise to add to the over used road noise and pollution. Continued problem but new issue last 4 months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 73 Bouncer's Lane, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Edge or road surface removed., 17th January
item.description:
The edge of the road surface is damaged and has been broken up and removed. When the road sweeper lorry goes over it, the surface is further eroded and removed. I have witnessed this twice.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 The Lawns, Gotherington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped rubbish, 17th January
item.description:
Thornbury Close is council owned. Rubbish has been dumped here since before Christmas.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Thornbury Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep potholes, 17th January
item.description:
The whole village is full of potholes. Some get fixed, and others get left to get bigger and bigger. I understand there to be some sort of sizing rule so that the council only fix certain sized potholes, but fixing one and leaving another one right next to it, which is only going to get bigger, is really stupid in my opinion.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Blacksmith Lane, The Leigh
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No street lighting., 17th January
item.description:
No street lighting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 69 Alstone Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kerb outside 70 Colesbourne protruding, 16th January
item.description:
As you look at the driveway outside 70 Colesbourne Rd, the kerb to the left hand side sticks out. This has caused damage to car tyres when parking on a number of occasions if bumped accidentally, most recently bursting a tyre.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 70 Colesbourne Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown vegetation - access to footbridge between alleyway , Andorra Way- Melville Rd over A4, 16th January
item.description:
A resident has reported overgrown vegetation at both ends of the footbridge and also a ‘step’ in the footpath at one end making it difficult for her to access the footbridge with her shopping trolley.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smashed cone and sand bag left behind by road contractors at station roundabout Gloucester Road, 15th January

Can someone pick it up please. Thanks

item.title: Large piece of cardboard dumped, 15th January
item.description:
This piece of cardboard was dumped in Falkland Place, over the fence from Graham Place, at about 10am today. I would just move it myself but littering and flytipping on Falkland Place has been a real problem over the last couple of years and needs dealing with at source.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 40 Falkland Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Parking in disabled bay, 14th January
item.description:
This vehicle regularly parks in this disabled bay on Tivoli street. Utterly disgraceful behaviour. Use a blue badge or park elsewhere.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 52b Tivoli Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Footpaths, 14th January
item.description:
Public footpath is a dangerous hazard. The pavement is raised, cracked and a trip / fall hazard. Health &Safety Hazard from children to adults.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Middleton Lawn, Innsworth
Report on FixMyStreet
